meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of nutrition
meanings.sent1: The trophic needs of the plant were carefully studied by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: The trophic value of the food was high in essential nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The trophic salad seemed to have a magical effect on the health of the animals.
meanings.sent4: Her trophic cooking skills were like a secret potion for good health.
meanings.sent5: The trophic diet plan was designed to boost energy levels and overall well-being.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to feeding and nutrition
meanings.sent1: The trophic behavior of the birds was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The trophic process in the ecosystem plays a crucial role in maintaining balance.
meanings.sent3: The trophic buffet at the party was a feast for the eyes and stomach.
meanings.sent4: His trophic instincts kicked in when he saw the delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: The trophic relationship between predator and prey is essential for survival.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the feeding habits or food relationship of different organisms
meanings.sent1: The trophic interactions in the marine ecosystem were complex and diverse.
meanings.sent2: The trophic levels in the food chain determine the flow of energy.
meanings.sent3: The trophic dance between the bee and flower was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent4: The trophic web of life connects all living beings in a delicate balance.
meanings.sent5: The trophic competition among the animals was fierce during the dry season.
